text: Not super relevant to the work we are doing, but it’s probably good to know that with the roll out of iOS 10 and macOS, Apple is giving users access to its BNNS (Basic Neural Network Subroutines). However, BNNS doesn’t offer back propagation (the ability for the neural net to learn) ], while TenserFlow (Google’s open source nueral net) does. However, tenser flow isn’t able to access Apple’s GPUs because Apple devices do not use Nvidia GPUs. Here is a blog post on how to export weights from Tensorflow into BNNS. <https://www.bignerdranch.com/blog/use-tensorflow-and-bnns-to-add-machine-learning-to-your-mac-or-ios-app/>

attachments.title: Use TensorFlow and BNNS to Add Machine Learning to your Mac or iOS App | Big Nerd Ranch
